moves.2... dxc4: I think I'm starting to like Queen's Gambit Acceped more.
moves.5... a6: Winning back that initial pawn is taking a while. The big exchange that follows here destroys both our queenside flanks, leaving neither side with a clear advantage.
moves.6. axb5 Bxb5 7. Nxb5 Nd7 8. Qc2: Not sure why I did this
moves.12... Bb4+ 13. Nc3 Ne4: Black is applying a lot of pressure.
moves.14. Bb2 Ndf6 15. cxb5 Qa5 16. Ke2 Bxc3 1: I think this was a bad move, eventually gaining me the knight at e4.
moves.19. Bd3 O-O 20. f3 Qd5 21. fxe4 Qg5: This move trapped black's queen in a confined space; I spend a few turns trying to box her in further.
moves.22. Qf2 Ra8 23. h4 Qh5 24. Be2 Qh6 25. e:
Black's knight forks my bishop and queen; what to do?

Seeing pending knight forks is something I really need to work on!
moves.26. Qf3: I pretend I'm saving my queen and sacrificing my bishop. I hope he thinks I moved the queen just to threaten e4.
moves.26... Nxc3: He doesn't see it. This move doesn't only expose his rook, it also means checkmate.
